Uses of Interface
GlobalHelper

    • Uses of GlobalHelper in <Unnamed>

      Classes in <Unnamed> that implement GlobalHelper 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Boost
      Boost Represents the Boost item and its effect One of the three items that can be used by Player.
      class  Camera
      Camera Used for following the player around the World This is a simple class which keeps track of the player as they move around the map, making sure the viewport is centered on them.
      class  Dog
      Dog Represents the Dog Enemy Dog has fairly simple behaviour, and is a real top gal.
      class  Elephant
      Elephant Represents the Elephant Enemy Elephant is the most basic Enemy and can be considered a template upon which additional behaviours could be added.
      class  Enemy
      Enemy Abstract class from which specific Enemy subclasses can be created and instantiated This abstract class defines standard methods that will be inherited by the different subtypes of Enemy, namely Octopus, Dog and Elephant.
      class  Item
      Item Abstract class from which all concrete Item classes inherit.
      class  Octopus
      Octopus Represents the Octopus Enemy Octopus is, as said in the spec, a bit of a jerk, and if within a certain range of the Player will target them instead of the waypoints, attempting to collide with them.
      class  Oil
      Oil Represents the Oil item and its effect One of the three items that can be used by Player.
      class  Panel
      The status panel.
      class  Player
      Player Represents the player of the game Handles things specific to the player.
      class  Racer
      Racer Abstract class which represents all karts driving around on the map This class handles the bulk of things that define a Racer (someone in a kart) in the game world.
      class  RenderableObject
      RenderableObject Abstract class from which all other rendered objects are derived The highest level class representing objects rendered into the game world.
      class  Tomato
      Tomato Represents the Tomato item and its effect One of the three items that can be used by Player.
      class  World
      World Represents the entire game world Every other object in the main game frame is instantiated here.
